result.execSummary:
The defendant Gregory Todd Bowman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Gregory Todd Bowman is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Gregory Todd Bowman was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

CO:  RJK for SRN, RPT: Evelyn Young, Clerk: E. Ferrill, ADA:  Karl E. Anderson,  DF ATTY:  Brian Thomas Smestad for today,  DF:  Gregory Todd Bowman appeared. DE appeared after court to set up a Pymt Plan as directed by the Judge.  DE was advised that he has been sent his 30 day notice for Collections & that he has the option of setting up the Pymt Plan again & making pymts to the court or that we will be turning his debt over to a Coll Agency, they will actively pursue coll of his debt, & he would have to make pymts to them.  DE stated he wished to have the debt turned over to the Coll Agency.  Includes 16TR916, 16CM442, 16CM147, 17CF104, 17CM683, 17CF128.  jaf

From DE on 9-11-18 stating he thinks he missed court on 8-28-18, but is unsure why as he thought everything was turned over to a Coll Agency.  DE was advised that his balances were converted to a Civil Jmt, but that upon receipt of his final atty bill, the Judge requested a Pymt Hearing, which he was notified of by mail.  DE stated he is no longer at the address on file & was unaware of the court date.  DE also stated the address on file is his mom's address, he has a new mailing address, & his mom does not ck the mail regularly (Note:  when I ret'd the DE's call, his mom answered the phone).  DE was advised he may turn himself into the Jail before 10 am M - F or pay the purge provision of $500.  Includes 16TR916, 16CM442, 16CM147, 17CF104, 17CM683 and 17CF128.  jaf

Court Commissioner: Tim Heckmann, Reporter: Tape, Clerk: Benoy  2:29    ADA:   Karl E. Anderson   DF ATTY:  Ryan A. Shervey   DF:  Gregory Todd Bowman appeared from jail.  INCLUDES:  Prelim on 18CF24, STC ON 17CF128, 16CT226 & 16CT249 and Payment hearing on 16CM147, 16CM442, 16TR916 & 17CF104.   Atty Anderson states he is ready to proceed. Witness is present.  Atty Shervey states he has just been appointed and is requesting a short continuance.  DF wishes to proceed.  Atty Anderson will waive time limits.  Court wishes Atty Shervey remain for today's hearing.    RECESS   Case recalled  3:02   State calls New Richmond Officer K Radtke.   Witness sworn.  ADA Anderson questions witness.  Witness identifies DF.  Atty Shervey cross.  Atty Anderson redirect. Witness excused.  ADA Anderson requests the court take judicial notice of the bond in 17CF128.  No objection by Atty Shervey.  Court takes judicial notice of the bond in 17CF128.   Atty Shervey calls A Burton.  Witness sworn.  Atty Shervey direct.  ADA Anderson cross.  Witness excused.  Argument by ADA Anderson.  Argument by Atty Shervey.   Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial.  Attys to schedule arraignment with JA.  Bond argument by Atty Shervey.  ADA Anderson objects.  Bond continues.  Bond hearing may be scheduled with SRN.  mab

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Michael Edward Nieskes DF ATTY: Arne Richard Skatrud DF: Gregory Todd Bowman appeared. Case called at 3:01. Includes 15CM364, 16CM147, 16CM442 (all PayH) 17CF86, 17CF104 (Plea Hearing). DA Nieskes updates the court. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads    to Ct 1 and 2 in 17CF128 and pleads   to amended Ct. 1 in 17CF104 to misdemeanor battery 940.19 (1)(a). DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 and 2 in 128 withholding the entry of judgment in Ct. 1 in favor of the DJOC. Court finds the DE guilty of the amended Ct. 1 to 940.19 (1)(a) in 17CF104. On motion of the State without objection, Crt dismisses with prejudice Ct 3, 4, 5 in 17CF128.  Courts signs the DJOC in Ct. 1 of 17CF128. Sentencing arguments. DE makes statement. Crt orders:
On Ct. 2 in 17CF128, Sentence W/H
2 years probation with conditions:
- 4 months County Jail STAYED. 
- DE to have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Allen Bauermeister or Steven Ryan in his non professional life.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person. 
- Costs of $243.00
- Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge of $200.00.
Credit for 92 days against ultimate sentence. 
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times . This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. 
- Random and regular testing. 
- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
- AODA assessment and any recommended treatment. 
- Letter of apology to both law enforcement officers.
- DE to participate in restorative justice if officers are willing to participate. 
- Assessment for anger if agent agrees. 
- MRT if agent agrees. 
- DE to maintain employment or education.
 
On 17CF104 Court orders Sentence W/H
2 years probation concurrent to and same conditions as Ct. 2 in 17CF128.
Probation is concurrent without prejudice to consecutive sentencing in the event of Probation revocation.
- Costs of $243.00
- Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge of $200.00.

Court orders on 15CM364, 16CM147, 16CM442 all Warrants quashed, and all lifts all suspensions on all files. 
DE to meet with the payment clerk and set up a payment plan to commence by Oct. 1, 2017.

DE to report to probation by 4:00pm on 06-14-20107.

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:  Erica Ellenwood   DF ATTY:  Joseph Robert Caton   DF:  Gregory Todd Bowman appeared. Case called at 4:06 p.m. Court notes these matters were set for a pre trial conference. ADA Ellenwood states there is a resolution and recites agreement.   Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads GUILTY to amended Ct 1 Co. Ord. 52 Disorderly Conduct in 16CM147. DE pleads GUILTY to Ct. 1 Misd. Bail Jumping in 16CM442. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of amended Ct. 1 Co. Ord. 52 Disorderly Conduct in 16CM147 and GUILTY to Ct. 1 Misd. Bail Jumping in 16CM442. On motion of the State without objecton, Crt dismisses Ct 2 in 16CM147 and Ct. 2 in 16CM442. Sentencing arguments. Atty Caton requesting expungement. 

Crt orders:

Ct. 1 in 16CM147:

- Fine in the amount of $295.00

Ct. 1 in 16CM442:

- 1 day jail. 1 day jail credit. TIME SERVED

- Court costs of $243.00 and DNA Surcharge of $200. DE to set up a payment plan.

- DNA Sample

- May apply for expungement after a period of 1 year. Must have no further charges.
Pre-trial conference on September 6, 2016 at 03:45 pm.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Peter L.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
